intro: Helianthella majuscula, commonly known as the giant helianthella, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in mountainous regions. The plant features a basal rosette of leaves and produces yellow flowers in the spring. Its botanical characteristics include hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and sagebrush steppe.
